prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object Base** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotations or translations. *Sketch Face 1:* 1. Draw a circle on the XY plane with the center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. *Extrusion 1:* 1. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.1875 units. 3. Set the operation to create a new body. The final dimensions of the part should be approximately 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.1875 units in height. **Part 2: Tapered Top Section** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, slightly tapered shape, dimensions approximately 10 units in length, 5 units in width, and 3 units in height. This part will be cut from the previous part to form a tapered top section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: *Coordinate System 2:* 1. Set the Euler angles to (0, 0, 0) 2. Set the translation vector to (0.1605, 0.176, 0.1875) *Sketch Face 2:* 1. Draw a series of connected lines on the XY plane to form a closed shape with 5 line segments. The line segment starts should be at (0, 0.2891), (0.0625, 0.0228), (0.335, 0.0), (0.441, 0.2521), and back to (0, 0.2891). *Extrusion 2:* 1. Scale the sketch by 0.441. 2. Extrude the sketch along the negative normal vector by 0.0938 units. 3. Set the operation to cut the current part from the previous part. The final dimensions of this part should align with the description in the JSON file, approximately 10 units in length, 5 units in width, and 3 units in height. The shape of the part will be a rectangular prism with a tapered top section.</description>
